Class selectionSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • selectionSort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class selectionSort
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The selectionSort class is is used to implement a Selection Sorting process on an Array of random integers that are automatically generated by the algorithm, the class can be used to either animate the bubble sort process or record the time taken to fully sort a single array. Runs as a single thread.
    Author:
    Oliver Palmer, stuNumber 12089466

      • selectionSort

        selectionSort(int i,
              drawPanel d,
              boolean animate,
              java.util.ArrayList<arrayStore> l)
        Constructor for selectionSort
        Parameters:
        i - int, determine the size of the array to be sorted
        d - drawPanel, the JPanel that the animation is draw on
        animate - boolean, to determine whether the class is being accessed for animation or analysis
        l - ArrayList, used to store the sort time and array size when performing analysis

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public void sort()
        Sort method, used to begin the sorting progress, records the time in nano seconds then divides by 1000 to convert the value to microseconds. If the class is initialised to analyse the data then this method records the timetaken and array size in the array list provided by the constructor

      • SelectionSort

        private void SelectionSort(int[] a)
        SelectionSort method, assumes the first item in the array is the minimum value then cycles through every other item comparing it to the minimum, if an item is less than the current minimum this is set to the new minimum. Once every item has been compared and the minimum value is established the minimum value is moved to the start of the array. The process is then repeated excluding the first value of the array as this is already considered sorted.
        Parameters:
        a - integer array, the array to be sorted

      • swap

        private void swap(int[] a,
                  int x,
                  int y)
        Swap method used to swap two values in the array
        Parameters:
        a - the array containing the values to be swapped
        x - the index of one of the values to be swapped
        y - the index of the other value to be swapped
